title: Bond...
content: ... James Bond. Can anyone recommend some fonts that mimic the 007 aesthetic? thnx for your help!
author: paul d hunt

comments.content:
Paul,

James Bond is one of my favourite character. It’s hard though to say which typeface that would fit him best? This must vary a lot from person to person depending on memories etc. Who knows, you might find some of mine good enough?  
 [http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090831142535/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")

[http://www.8ung.at/weisshaupt/James%20Bond%20007/jbstart2.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090831142535/http:/www.8ung.at/weisshaupt/James%20Bond%20007/jbstart2.html "http://www.8ung.at/weisshaupt/James%20Bond%20007/jbstart2.html")  
As you can see the only consistent thing with Bond is the 007/gun logo and semi-clad women. I had to recreate the look for a job and used imagery rather than relying on type in the end, the more recent use a flare serif. I think I used Friz Quadrata.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/friz-quadrata-sh/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090831142535/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/friz-quadrata-sh/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/friz-quadrata-sh/")  
Tim

Some of these might be helpful...

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewsilhoue...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090831142535/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewsilhouettes "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewsilhouettes")

Paul, Jimmy G at [Typeco](http://web.archive.org/web/20090831142535/http:/www.typeco.com/MainFrameset.html) has some that could work. Glyphic Neue and a few of the Trapper variants could definitely work.
i just got outta the car with jimmy g... i’ll hafta look back at his website.
